alert.note: Alert for Custer; Fallon (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 12:57PM MST until February 23 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Snow accumulations between 6 and 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Custer and Fallon. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Periods of snow, gusty winds and blowing snow will make travel difficult to impossible at times. Temperatures will fall to near zero Tuesday night and combine with gusty winds to produce bitter cold wind chills. The cold, wet, and windy conditions will be dangerous for young livestock. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A period of snow will develop tonight into Tuesday morning with 3 to 5 inches expected. After a break, additional snowfall of 3 to 6 inches will develop for Wednesday into Thursday morning.
info.instruction: Becoming stranded in this winter storm could be deadly as temperatures plummet Tuesday afternoon. Travel is discouraged from Tuesday afternoon through Thursday morning. If you must travel, keep a survival kit with blankets food and water in the vehicle. Let someone know where you are going and when you plan to arrive. For the latest road conditions, call 5 1 1.
